title: C++ Notes
text:
Definition - Time Complexity is the relationship about how the time will grow as the input grows.
Time Complexity != Total Time Taken by a Machine to execute.
There are mainly 4 points for Time Complexity:

Always look for the Worst Case Time Complexity.
Always look at the Complexity for Large Data.
Always Ignore Constants.
Always Ignore Less Dominant Terms. From Point 2






If the recurrence become more complex then finding the time complexity will become harder. So, Akra-Bazzi method is the easy and simple method to find the Time Complexity.
The method goes as follows:
Let \(p\) be the unique real number for which \[\sum_{i=1}^{k} a_ib_i^p = 1\]
Then,
\[T(x) = \Theta\biggl(x^p + x^p \int_1^x \frac{g(u)}{u^{p+1}} du\biggl)\]



The usage of Asymptotic Notation is for specifying and for the identification of the upper and lower bounds.
\[\lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{f(n)}{g(n)}\]
Below are the Asymptotic Notations:


This is the Upper Bound and the complexity cannot go beyond this Upper Bound.
\[\lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{f(n)}{g(n)} < \infty\]



This is the opposite of Big - \(O\) Notation. This is the Lower Bound and the function complexity will atleast require Lower Bound complexity.
\[\lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{f(n)}{g(n)} > 0\]



The Big - \(\Theta\) Notation was created when a function lies in both Upper Bound (Big - \(O\)) and Lower Bound (Big - \(\Omega\)).
\[0 < \lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{f(n)}{g(n)} < \infty\]



The Little - \(o\) is same as Big - \(O\) but it is slightly loose and strictly lesser than.
\[\lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{f(n)}{g(n)} = 0\]



The Little - \(\omega\) is same as Big - \(\Omega\) but it is slightly loose and strictly greater than.
\[\lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{f(n)}{g(n)} = \infty\]





Space Complexity is measured by combining the Input Space and the Auxilary Space. The same Asymptotic Notations discussed above are the ones used for Space Complexity.





Resources Used:

Click Here!


This is the end of Day - 1.

title: C++ Notes
text:
Recursion

Important Points

Recursion helps in solving bigger/complex problems into smaller problems which can be solved in a simple way.
You can convert a Recursion solution into Iterative and Vice Versa.
Space Complexity is not constant due to Recursive Calls.



Types of Recurrence Relations

Linear Recurrence Relation
Divide & Conquer Recurrence Relation



How to understand & approach a problem?

Identify if you can break down problem into smaller problems.
Write the Recurrence Relations if needed.
Draw the Recursive Tree.
About the Tree:

See the flow of functions, how they are getting into the stack.
Identify and Focus on Left Tree Calls and Right Tree Calls.
Draw the tree and pointers using Pen & Paper for better understanding. *
Use a debugger to see the flow.

See how the values and what type of values are returned at each step. See where the function will come out. In the end you will come out of the main function.
Three Variables to concentrate on:

Arguments
Return Type
Body of Function

Why am I doing this? I have created a python library, learnt how to use Tensorflow and other ML Libraries. There was always a missing piece needed to be filled.
The missing piece is DSA.

title: 90 Days DSA Challenge
text:
Shall we Start Now Already? ü§®
From 26th October, 2023 the challenge will officially start.

Notes Available. Click Here!

Let‚Äôs go Step-by-Step.

Choosing the Programming Language 


I. Choosing the Programming Language
As I want to become a Quant Developer. The most used programming language is C++.

Note: Most firms in the world use the latest C++ version. The current version of C++ is 20 as of the time of this challenge.

Insert Back

Delete Front
Delete Back
Delete Middle
Length
Print Linked List

I have completed Stack.
Implemented Operations for Stack are:

Push
Pop
Peek

Stack is Full
Print Stack

title: Setup TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Hugging Face Transformer on Mac in 5 Minutes
text: Let‚Äôs prepare your Apple Silicon Mac, whether it‚Äôs an M1 or M2 variant, for machine learning and data science.

title: Setup TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Hugging Face Transformer on Mac in 5 Minutes
section: Who will benefit from this blog post?
text:
Who will benefit from this blog post?
If you have recently acquired an Apple Silicon Mac, specifically one of the M1 or M2 models, and you‚Äôre eager to embark on machine learning and data science endeavors, this post is tailored for you.

title: Setup TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Hugging Face Transformer on Mac in 5 Minutes
section: What to expect from this post:
text:
What to expect from this post:
This post is designed to guide you through the process of installing essential machine learning and data science packages, including TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformer, pandas, NumPy, Jupyter, matplotlib, and scikit-learn, on your Apple Silicon Mac. It also ensures that these packages run smoothly by providing sample code.

title: Setup TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Hugging Face Transformer on Mac in 5 Minutes
section: Are you a novice or an expert?
text:
Are you a novice or an expert?
If you‚Äôre new to the setup of environments and software packages, consider watching the video version in conjunction with the comprehensive written instructions below.
For those experienced in setting up environments, the concise text-based instructions should suffice.

title: Setup TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Hugging Face Transformer on Mac in 5 Minutes
text:
Video guide available:
You can access a detailed step-by-step video guide of the content covered in this article on YouTube.

title: Setup TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Hugging Face Transformer on Mac in 5 Minutes
text:
Let‚Äôs Start üèÅ
I will detail each step so a beginner can also be transition their journey to data science smoothly.

1 - Install Homebrew
Visit - Homebrew
Copy and Paste the command present on the website or use the below command in the Terminal:
/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"


2 - Install Anaconda or MiniConda
I prefer Anaconda and I will be using it for further process.
Visit - Anaconda Downloads
Visit - Installation Guide
For Command Line -
bash ~/Downloads/Anaconda\ 2023.09\ MacOSX-arm64.sh
Set Conda Base to Activate by default -
conda config --set auto_activate_base True
